abstract: The move could allay fears that JPMorgan could face a big credit risk if it were forced to hold the loan, the biggest ever by a single bank, on its books.
snippet: The move could allay fears that JPMorgan could face a big credit risk if it were forced to hold the loan, the biggest ever by a single bank, on its books.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase has fully syndicated its $20 billion loan to AT&T for the cellphone carrier’s bid to buy T-Mobile USA, spreading it out across 11 other banks, according to a regulatory filing.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: JPMorgan’s $20 billion financing for AT&T raises concerns that banks may go it alone on riskier deals.
snippet: JPMorgan’s $20 billion financing for AT&T raises concerns that banks may go it alone on riskier deals.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase’s record $20 billion financing for AT&T is turning bankers green the world over. With this as the new benchmark for credit-hungry corporate executives, the worry is that banks wind up competing in a game of one-upmanship that leads some to fly solo on riskier deals.

headline.main: The Interplay of JPMorgan and AT&T

byline.original: By Agnes T. Crane and Rob Cox
